p: Cathelicidins are a class of NAMPs that were identified in different animal species, including mamals, birds, fish, reptiles and amphibians ( Wang et al., 2008). Several cathelicidin related antimicrobial peptides (CRAMPs) have been discovered from various snake venoms that possesses potent antimicrobial activity. Barros et al. reviewed the current and previous reported data on cathelicidins identified in snake venoms. Authors summarized the data on cathelicidins including its chemistry, characterization, pharmacological action especially antimicrobial and antibioflim effects as well as their mechanism of action. They also highlighted the potentials cathelicidins for the development of novel antibiotics to defend antibiotic-resistant bacteria.
